intro: Acinodendron multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The plant is typically shrub-like in growth habit and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
